Package net.minecraftforge.common.loot

Class GlobalLootModifierSerializer<T extends IGlobalLootModifier>

java.lang.Object
net.minecraftforge.common.loot.GlobalLootModifierSerializer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the Type to deserialize
Direct Known Subclasses:
GlobalLootModifiersTest.DungeonLootEnhancerModifier.Serializer, GlobalLootModifiersTest.SilkTouchTestModifier.Serializer, GlobalLootModifiersTest.SmeltingEnchantmentModifier.Serializer, GlobalLootModifiersTest.WheatSeedsConverterModifier.Serializer
public abstract class GlobalLootModifierSerializer<T extends IGlobalLootModifier> extends Object
Abstract base deserializer for LootModifiers. Takes care of Forge registry things.
Modders should extend this class to return their modifier and implement the abstract read method to deserialize from json.

  • Method Details

    • read

      public abstract T read(ResourceLocation location, com.google.gson.JsonObject object, LootItemCondition[] ailootcondition)
      Most mods will likely not need more than
      return new MyModifier(conditionsIn)
      but any additional properties that are needed will need to be deserialized here.
      Parameters:
      location - The resource location (if needed)
      object - The full json object (including ILootConditions)
      ailootcondition - An already deserialized list of ILootConditions

    • write

      public abstract com.google.gson.JsonObject write(T instance)
      Write the serializer to json. Most serializers won't have to do anything else than makeConditions(net.minecraft.world.level.storage.loot.predicates.LootItemCondition[]) Which simply creates the JsonObject from an array of ILootConditions.

    • makeConditions

      public com.google.gson.JsonObject makeConditions(LootItemCondition[] conditions)
      Helper to create the json object from the conditions. Add any extra properties to the returned json.
